message.content:
A binoculars is a hand-held optical device used to magnify and view distant objects. 
Most binoculars have two symmetrical lenses that are mounted side by side on an adjustable frame. 
They typically have a black or dark colored, textured rubber coating for a secure grip. 
The shape of binoculars is usually elongated and rectangular, with a bridge connecting the two lenses. 
Binoculars are commonly used by outdoor enthusiasts, bird watchers, and hunters. 
They may also be used for stargazing, surveillance, and military purposes. 
The visual characteristics of binoculars include their magnifying power, field of view, prism type, and lens coatings.
